page.title: 14DENTON.
page.content: It is a very small settlement west of Walworth. There are about twelve houses. One row of old cottages has had a second storey added on, after it closed as a public house. These belong to the Raby estate and were used by estate and farm workers. Now many of the residents are retired, or commute to Darlington to work. In the centre of Denton there are two large farms which were originally the main source of{employment}for the village and surrounding inhabitants. There is an old{school}on the outskirts of the village. This shows signs of a modern extension on to the original school house showing an increase in population during the middle part of this century. However the school has recently closed as {population}has since declined.
